The United States will have 6-7 trillion U.S. Treasury bonds due at the end of June, of which 2-3 trillion will need to be purchased by other countries; Before the end of June, few countries will reach any agreement with the United States, nor will they purchase these maturing U.S. Treasury bonds. On the contrary, many countries will gradually sell U.S. Treasury bonds because the U.S. credit is declining.
